transcripts.text: Welcome back to Liberty and Finance and Reluctant Preppers.  I'm your host, Dunagan Kaiser.

We haven't found it yet.  But we thought if we told the entire group of our subscribers and listeners, our entire family here, the wisdom of the tribe will be much better than anything that we could do on our own.  So can you guys please help us out?  Help us find our new place.  And here's some of the priorities that we're looking for along the way.

Since I grew up on a lake in Minnesota, we're looking for a clean, spring-fed sand bottom and a crystal clear lake, preferably private.  so there's no public access.  And we'd like it to look a little bit like Torch Lake in Michigan and Flathead Lake, which is in Montana.  So if you want to look at those pictures and see what we're talking about, that's what we're looking for, only private, not public.

Yeah, no public access would be great.  We'd also like it to be able to have some acreage if possible.  And also in a low population density county.  Would be a plus.  Not near any big metro area.  And also in a state that's got low taxes and low regulation, something that's a real constitutionally minded state.  And because we're both Lyme survivors and we've suffered for the last several years through tick-borne illnesses, we were kind of tick phobic and so a state that has low incident of tick borne illnesses would be great.  and so if you guys have any other things we had on our list is that uh let's see we said low regulation.
organic food producers would also be a plus.  a lot of these are pluses and they don't necessarily have to be there but we would appreciate if they were there.
